content.description:
A tall, featured arete with a crux near the top. 

  Start just right of the arete in a small left facing dihedral.  Follow flakes and sidepulls up and left until you reach the arete.  Meander between the face and the arete until you reach the chains.
content.protection: Bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Leftmost route on The Moat Wall, just right of the arrete, just before the stream.35.1046973, -85.6305363

content.description: The best line at The Moat.  Great climbing on great holds.
content.location: Left of Minimal Invasion, 10 feet right of Mosaic.

content.description: Mostly cruiser moves on great holds to a couple harder sequences up top.
content.location: Next line to the right of Ryobi Royale.

content.description: Stick Clip. Delicate start on the left leads to restful climbing and a hard finish.
content.location: The route is in the middle of the wall. Can be identified by the hueco

content.description:
This area is currently closed due to peregrine falcon nesting. Please see the SCC web site for updates.

 A small cove of East facing rock near the stream. Most of the routes are vertical and fall between 10a and 12a. Apparently, the stream creates an A/C effect making this a good Summer area.

 Remember, if nature calls while you are climbing at The Moat, stay 200 feet from the stream that flows from Castle Rock and do not tamper with hoses that run down the hill. These supply Ms. Phillips(the landowner) with her water.
